Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10 STUNNING HOTEL AT BUDGET PRICES!”
Reviews.Author: Dubai-Mafia
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel, next to the clock tower! perfect for my short stay, beautiful breath taking interior hotel with friendly nice staff, BARGAIN PRICED HOTEL if you shop around, rooms are like a 5 star beach resort!!!!! stunning large rooms! underground parking! 10 out of 10 however pool is small and not much sun but apart from that everything was stunning!!!! will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Danmoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights during the cool month of January. Check in easy and quick. I'm always surprised that people would allow a hotel to retain their passport. I NEVER leave my passport with anyone. In this case I insisted they copy it and give it back immediately. No dramas. Room was adequate, clean with a nice creek view. No tea making facilities (annoying) but room service was 24 hours, quick and reasonably priced. Had to ask for a robe. Lift waiting time ok. Local supermarkets close by and a 15 minute walk to Deira City Centre Shopping Centre (big and good range of shops). Breakfast in restaurant pretty average. Order room service. Cheaper and you can eat it in your pjs! In Perth this would be a 3 star. We didn't have our kids with us but it would be ideal/safe for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FWTraveller
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a single night on my way to Abu Dhabi. Very reasonable cost (pre-booked on bookings.com) and was upgraded to a suite (514) with a creek view. Very nice room , a bit ornate perhaps for modern tastes, but a huge comfy bed, all the nice to haves in the bathroom. I couldn't get a cab at 6pm Thursday evening so I walked from Union station on Dubai Metro as it was a cool evening. Simple 5 minute check in, they did keep my passport, but that wasn't a problem. The hotel is 'dry' and so I had to go out for my weekly beer. Lively cafe on ground floor. Breakfast on the mezzanine was fine the next morning and check-out only took 5 minutes. If you want to be in that area of Diera and it's your own money you are spending, then use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Divyalakshmi S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this apartment thrice in the month of December 2011. It was a school trip with 32 undergraduates. Location The hotel is within walking distance to various important areas. It is near the international airport and metro station. The hotel has a strategic location near the Dubai Creek where my friends and I have evening strolls with chilly breezes. Right across the creek is the Bur Dubai area with the Dubai Museum and a wide range of shops selling goods like carpets and clothes for bargain. Cheap and good eateries are located behind the hotel. In addition, there are supermarkets, beauty salons and laundry service providers. Room The room was equipped with comfortable sofas and beds – making it a cosy place to reside in. The homey yet classy ambience of the room is attributed to the beautiful oil paintings hung around the room. Though the apartment provides hairdryers upon request, the iron and ironing board are already placed within the apartment. The kitchen is well equipped with an oven, refrigerator, washing machine, stove and a cabinet filled with cooking and eating utensils. Service The hotel provided us the service of keeping our luggage in a hotel room while we travelled to Qatar- Doha and returned to check into the hotel again on another date. I had the misfortune of misplacing one of my bags in the hotel – and the latter contained important items. The staff was really helpful in searching for my misplaced bag and it was returned to me by Jose on Christmas Day. Without the help of the hotel staff, I would have never been able to retrieve my bag. My laptop always has problems with the internet connection via wireless. I had to ask for IT assistance and this became a ritual every night. The IT staff patiently and religiously helped me connect to the internet every night. After 3 nights of continuously asking for IT assistance, embarrassed, I stopped short of asking for further assistance. To my surprise, Nawaz, the IT staff turned up at my doorstep at 11+pm [the usual time I call for IT assistance] to check on my internet connectivity and better still – he managed to permanently resolve my laptop issue. The concierge staff - Charlie and Thomas are friendly and ready to help us anytime from the booking of the cab to tours and helping out with the luggage. The reception staff consisting of Hisham, Rose and Marwan are quick and helped me to change my rooms when needed even during peak period. Abdullah, Savan and Jose ensured smooth and fast check in for all the 32 students and 2 coordinators within 20 minutes. Amenities The hotel itself is well-equipped with many travel agencies, hairdressers and restaurants. There is a pool and a gym. Likes & Dislikes There are few negative points about the hotel, in my opinion. My first complaint is of the lifts. As there are only 2 lifts servicing the 15 levels of the hotel, the waiting time for the lift may take longer than usual especially during the breakfast hours. My second complaint is that the swimming pool is rather small. Points that I like: the staff, the hotel location, the apartment itself and the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Below Premium”
Reviews.Author: Suresh75
Reviews.Content: I've stayed alone for 2 nights and the stay was good except few glitches. The room is big, clean and has two sections with 2 toilets (1 in the bathroom), 2 televisions, there are lot of furniture every where (more than required I think) with total 7 wooden chairs to sit. So has to look around carefully to not to crash into one. The bathroom is big and worked well, they even provide you a shaving kit, tooth brush, paste etc... apart from the regular soap and shampoo. The airconditioner's setting wasn't able to be changed, it was set at 19" which was very cold, next day it was at 22" and at the morning it was showing 19" - so be ready for a really chilling (cold) experience if you are going to stay there. The locality is good and you can walk around to many shopping areas, water taxis etc... The staff allowed me for a late checkout, break fast was reasonable and priced reasonable as well. They have a valet parking but with a single driver to manage the job with a small parking to manage in front of the hotel, so expect delays and be patient (last day I had to wait for around 30 minutes to leave the area after picking my vehicle). But I feel except these minor issues, it's a good value for money hotel - if you are ready to manage yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nicely located Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: musharrafakhan
Reviews.Content: One may prefer this hotel because of location and low price if compared with the facilities and comfort. Walking distance to Matro station rigga and 10 AED from city center. Although far from the heart of Bur Dubai, but distance and cost can be saved by Dubai Matro. Rooms are nicely decorated and personally I like the carpeting very much. Very cool and calm atmosphere in such a way that you cannot be aware of the changes outside the room, even no clock in the room. I was so depressed while taking tea, only one tea bag was used for three cups of water. swimming pool is too small to enjoy. gym facility is good. food specially breakfast and service is good to satisfactory level. I faced a little bit discouraging reception, but later on good room service gave satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Priced well, good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: redladybiker
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in Dubai for a stopover this hotel is ideal, 40 AED taxi from the airport and 20 AED to the airport. The rate we paid was very cheap for the size and quality of the room,[33 UK pounds a night] the only negative was that there was no tea making facilities in the room. There was no noise from other rooms or the corridor, the room was clean but slightly dusty. The pool is small and on the rooftop. We did not eat at the hotel so we cannot comment. The hotel is a 10 AED ride from either the metro or City Centre Shoppping, a local supermarket is next door to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: JG_Wilmslow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Emirates Concorde in August 2011 during the Ramadam period. We arrived at the hotel early and had to hang around until a room became available. What made it tough for us was that there was no food or drink available because of Ramadan. The hotel staff are very helpful especially the concierge staff. The breakfast is excellent. The wifi worked fine. The hotel is very conveniently located for the malls and shopping centres. We took a city tour and had an excellent time with a very knowledgable driver. This was organised through the hotel travel centre. The hotel is very clean and beautiful design inside. On departure we got a complimentary hotel shuttle to the airport. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JitenUs
Reviews.Content: I've never been in such a hell hotel around the world and is the worst among the hotel in Dubai, I asked for An Adaptor and Iron before 1 hr and i receive it after 1 hr. WOw Very fast srvce. No hot water in swimming Pool during bath. When ever i ask for anything i will get it after 1 hr. Break fast was terrible and same everyday. Laundry didn't clean the cloth properly. Room cleaning was also not so good, But One of the staff working in night shift was very helpful and friendly. I like the service provided by him during our stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can give you my e- mail address and state all reasons why not to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Gord15_50
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a business hotel to recommend- lousy breakfast, noisy rooms, you pay a fortune for a nights stay and on top of that have to pay if you have a bottle of water in the room and another 3% fee when settling your bill with Amex. If you're happy with that and love over the top bad kitsch you may like this place...

Reviews.Title: “email me at dezdgc@live.co.uk and i reply with all the reasons to stay here”
Reviews.Author: dezdgc
Reviews.Content: fantastic well looked after. if your going to stay in dubai stay here. ideal location very good staff. fantastic food very clean. i can be e-mailed and advise or answer any questions on what you would like to know and if this hotel suits your needs thats how high i rate this hotel compared to others around about. been in all/most of them good for certain things but in my view maybe not recomended to stay in. any questions to me can be asked at dezdgc@live.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “Did Concorde not go out of service....LOL!”
Reviews.Author: Enigmablue
Reviews.Content: Sorry bad gag to start...it's not that bad but for our first time in Dubai i was expecting a bit more glitz and glamour from my accomodation. This isn't the place for that but luckily we only booked two nights then had booked another 4 nights at Emirates Harbour Hotel at the Dubai marina which had a bit more glitz. My father flew in from Glasgow a day before us and his standard room 607 (i think) was just your usual 'classic' looking hotel room. The bathroom was a bit dated but the rest of the decor looked fresh and clean although he did say the bed was rock hard. We arrived from Brissie refreshed (i love it when you get upgraded!!!) and we then moved into 9902, a 2 bed apartment which was an interesting mix with fake renaissance style furnishings and dodgy 1980's bathrooms. The apartment was big but the bedrooms were average size with only one ensuite. The kitchen had all the essentials but was grubby with broken and missing crockery and glasses. (Free) Breakfast is basic but ok and enough to keep you going. We ate in the restaurant one night which was like a ghost town, which is weird considering its packed in the morning. It was nothing special and the service was poor and slow seeing as we were the only people in there. We stayed here to experience the creek and souks but it was just in the middle of nothing with office blocks and some other hotels. A huge highway had to be negotiated to try and get to the creek so overall i feel the location is poor but at least the taxis are cheap. The Dubai City Centre Mall was 7dhms in a taxi (min fare is 10dhms) and we done the Big-Bus tour from there over 2 days. Its just a 'local' mall by Dubai standards but good enough for a short shopping trip. There's also a free shuttle bus back from the City Centre Mall which drops you near the footbridge and 24hr supermarket located just across the road from the hotel (and just up the road from the Big clock water tower thing). The supermarket was cheap as well for soft drinks, snacks etc. The pool was ok but it was empty (like the sauna and steam room which i had to switch on). The gym is split into two sides which i didn't find out about till day 2 thinking until then that it was weights and no cardio euqipment! Small and tired looking equipment but enough for a quick session. Overall it scrapes a 3-star rating for me but i know why concorde was put out of service...great in its day but now tired and ready for the makeover/scrap heap. Good place for a kip for a few nights but thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad enough to avoid, not good enough to recommend”
Reviews.Author: doomdoom
Reviews.Content: Plus points - nice room, everything clean and working and more than adequate. Fridge in room, but no tea/coffee facilities, big tv loads of channels. Nice hotel overall, big, light open spaces, the decor and feel were all fine. The online company we booked with (lastminute.com) had messed up our reservation and though they provided flights for 2 adults and a child, the room was only booked for 2 adults. The hotel reception dealt with this extremely well, an extra bed was provided, with no extra charge, inc the extra breakfast. Hotel 'extras' were quite reasonable. Minus points. No balcony and absolutely no way therefore of drying wet beach stuff (there was a clothesline in the bathroom but due to the aircon, clothes put on it took 3 days to dry) Breakfast was ok, but uninspiring and they have a strange system for getting coffee.. a waitress floats around with a jug every now and then, so if you just miss her 'cycle' you will have finished eating before your next chance to get a drink. Reception/concierge unhelpful about queries and requests, when we asked them to call us a taxi they offered the hotel car at four times the price. The free shuttle to/from the beach failed to collect us on the second day. Our complaint/query when we were forced to take a taxi back to the hotel met with no response. Location is fine-ish, ie its near the creek but a good 15 minutes walk to where its at ,in terms of restaurants, souks etc. Overall we were happy, we got a very good price deal and felt it was value for money, but it it was in the detail that it failed to deliver. Oh, and its a dry hotel, so if you need a drink/bar look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ergodictheory
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money. Very close to the airport 15 minutes drive. We initially booked for a family double room but that was upgraded to 3 bedroom suite. Which was nice. Although some of the furniture (sitting room) was showing some signs of wear and tear. The staff were helpful and very courteous. The swimming pool which was on the 9 floor was not so accessible but still fine. The breakfast was adequate. The hotel was clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: diane228
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel overpriced when one compares it with better hotels for half the price in places such as Singapore and Bangkok and would have included breakfast. It would rate as no more than three stars in Asia. We found the service slack. Room not serviced until 3pm. Bathroom floor not washed during our stay. Getting bell boy up to collect baggage took three attempts.Stroppy attitude in business centre when using the internet. The retaining of passports even though accommodation had been paid for months in advance and almost leaving without them! The Tent coffee shop needing 25 minutes to make a club sandwich despite there being only the two of us in the place. The mind boggles. We told them not to bother. None of the above rates as a four star hotel in our opinion. On the plus side it was in a central location and walkable distance to various locations.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: FrankHayden
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the best value Hotel I have ever experienced. Spacious accomadation, clean, great location and friendly staff. Our return flight was at 00.30 and we allowed a late check out 4p.m. There are no bar facilities, if this doesn't bother you then you are in for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience.”
Reviews.Author: jfranier
Reviews.Content: Requested to pay full amount upon arrival. Request to keep passport as an additional guarantee One evening, back from work, I found the door of my room opened. They just forgot to close it after cleaning (fortunately, nothing was missing in my room). Some staff pay very few attention to the customer: enter in the room in the morning while you are sleeping without looking at the "Do not disturb" red indication hanging at the door's knob... Low dedication to customer satisfaction, with regards to internet connection recurring problems, laundry pick up and delivery, airport pick up, restaurant orders... Food choice is very limited, which is an inconvenient for long stay customers. As a conclusion, I had a very bad experience in every field. This hotel does not diserve its 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: compassreaders
Reviews.Content: Reserved minimum priced room,but was large, with good furnishings and bathroom. Very comfortable mattress and pillows. Room very quiet, even though we were on first floor on busy Al Maktoum Road. Swimming pool not glamourous, but has shady areas (essential in May temperatures) with gym, suana and massage facilities. Would stay again at bargain price of £90 per night . Breakfast mediocre, but just across the road in Baniyas Road is a 5 star hotel of a famous chain that has wonderful breakfasts for 10 Dirhams more, and two amazing restaurants for dinner, one being the first Gordon Ramsay restaurant outside UK. Small supermarket that seems to sell everything in same block as Hotel Dubai Concorde, and two bigger local supermarkets in road behind hotel. Hotel is walking distance to Deira City Shopping Centre, and the Creek.

HotelInfo.Name: Emirates Concorde Hotel & Residence
HotelInfo.Address: Al Maktoum Rd, Dubai 64225, United Arab Emirates
